response.overview: Toronto based filmmakers Justin Diezmo and Christian Bunea met in 2016 while attending Ryerson University for film studies and have been collaborators since. Their first venture as co-directors saw the creation of the short documentary ‘As Niagara Falls’ in 2017, which garnered national recognition on CityTv, BuzzFeed News, the Vancouver Sun and more due to its provoking subject matter and filmmaking. Independently, Bunea directed 'Pacaroni' (Pendance Film Festival 2021 Official Selection, winner of Best Student Film at RIFFA 2021) as well as 'Square Peg' (VIFF 2022 Official Selection). Diezmo has directed 'finger' (NFFTY 2020 Official Selection, Cinefest Sudbury 2021 Official Selection).
response.title: LAUNDRY DAY
